item.title: About me
item.description: Hi, I’m Yoric, aka David Teller, I’m a Jack of all Threads at Element (aka Tech Lead). When I’m not producing code, I’m coordinating efforts within my team or between teams. I’ve been spotted spending time on mentoring junior developers and open-source contributors; federated/decentralized communication networks; protecting users making the Firefox web browser safer and faster; the Rust compiler and standard library; the SpiderMonkey JavaScript Virtual Machine; a micro-kernel; a next-gen browser engine; a few compilers; static analyzers; a few eBook readers; a programming language designed for multi-tiered web applications and services whose components distrust each other; a programming language designed for always-on, fault-tolerant, reboot-tolerant, hardware-replacement-tolerant, power-limited IoT applications; IoT for the disabled; IoT snooping countermeasure experiment; pedagogic robots; university teaching; high-school teaching; academic research; also, backpacking through exotic countries; … You can find my latest resume here.
